polished_script:
HOOK: A top 1% luxury agent just said Zillow saved his team. [ON-SCREEN: "ZILLOW SAVED MY TEAM"]

BRAND INTRO: "This is D.J. Paris with Keeping It Real Podcast, and this is your agent tip of the day."

SETUP: Jeff Biebuyck sells luxury homes in Calabasas and Hidden Hills â€” we're talking multimillion-dollar properties. When his hyper-local market got squeezed, he watched other top agents do what most do: dig in deeper, fight harder for the same shrinking pool of deals. [ON-SCREEN: "MARKET SQUEEZED = FIGHT HARDER?"] You know this feeling â€” when your area gets competitive, your first instinct is to double down, right? 
[15-SEC RE-HOOK]: But Jeff did the exact opposite, and it saved his business.

INSIGHT: Instead of fighting for scraps in one zip code, Jeff used Zillow Flex as a geographic expansion strategy. Not for leads â€” for territory. [ON-SCREEN: "ZILLOW FLEX = EXPANSION TOOL"] His exact words: "Zillow honestly kind of helps save our team... we were able to diversify spread out across all of greater Los Angeles." [ON-SCREEN: "DIVERSIFY ACROSS GREATER LA"] While other luxury agents waited for their micro-market to recover, Jeff's team was closing deals in six different areas. Most agents defend one territory. Top producers build multiple territories.

REFRAME: This isn't about Zillow â€” it's about thinking like a business owner instead of a territorial agent. Your market doesn't owe you deals. When your area contracts, you can either shrink with it or expand beyond it.

CTA: "Are you defending territory or building a business?"

CLOSE: "See you next time."
